topic: Sleep, Memory, and Learning: How to Use the Night Shift of Your Brain
target_audience: students, parents, and teachers shaping study/sleep routines

refs.content: Sleep deprivation before or after learning impairs memory; adequate sleep supports consolidation.
Physiological mechanisms: slow-wave sleep and REM support systems/synaptic consolidation.
Targeted memory reactivation during NREM produces small-to-moderate improvements in recall across domains.

special_instructions: Give concrete pre‑sleep and post‑study routines; caution about overclaiming TMR and emphasize healthy habits.
